title: least trusted Politician and why??

content: quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: The American people were clear in 2006 and 2008: Republicans. And, that will change when they see how crappy the Democrats are. Then, when Republicans are in charge again, the people will get sick of them and go back to the Democrats, and so on and so forth. Over and over, etc etc. You would think that people would get the hint after a while. Both parties are azzhats. It certainly seems to be going in that direction, whereas no party seems to make any "real change." We'll see how things go until the congressional elections in 2010. Until then, the democrats are the party in charge, and Mr. Obama has until 2012 for his first term. If the dems make the catastrophic mistakes that cost the repubs the 2006, and 2008 elections; then and only then would I be willing to support a Third Party. IMO, our political system is broke, but not yet completely broken. 2010/12, "may" well turn out to be a decisive turning point in US political history. It would however be unrealistic to think that Mr. Obama and his party are not unaware of futuristic events, even though such predictions on future events are speculative. Every President (and his party) wants what every First Term Administration wants, a Second Term! No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: The American people were clear in 2006 and 2008: Republicans. And, that will change when they see how crappy the Democrats are. Then, when Republicans are in charge again, the people will get sick of them and go back to the Democrats, and so on and so forth. Over and over, etc etc. You would think that people would get the hint after a while. Both parties are azzhats.

content: Poll: Paterson's Approval Rating Hits New Low Reported by: WROC-TV Monday, Mar 23, 2009 @11:25am EST Only 14 percent of voters are prepared to elect him in 2010. 67% say they prefer "someone else. " New Yorkers Continue to Move to Other States Reported by: WROC-TV Monday, Mar 23, 2009 @08:36am EST The exodus of New Yorkers to other states continues. That's according to the latest U.S. Census figures, which indicate residents moved out of New York at the third fastest rate in the country. Perhaps the only variable that keeps New York from having the highest out migration rate is the influx of immigrants, who mostly move to New York city.

content: Both parties (and the other third parties as well, to a lesser extent) are populated by people who have gotten good at playing "the game" and all they are interested in doing is winning it. Pelosi has pretty much admitted it - she is not interested in good governance, just increasing the power of the party in Congress. The Republicans are just the same (although more subtle). Still, my vote: The American voter. A person that can give a 14% approval rating to Congress as a whole while simultaneously giving their own Congressmen 60% approval ratings.
reply: Both parties (and the other third parties as well, to a lesser extent) are populated by people who have gotten good at playing "the game" and all they are interested in doing is winning it. content: Roland Burris-I did not have any contact with Blogo---well I might have talked with somebody from his staff----I tried to raise money for him, but coould not. Chuck Schumer, makes great statements about what he has does for the people, until you read and understand the bills he has passed. The one of his I like is you get up to a $1000 credit for text books to help poor struggling students. Sounds great, until you find out the qualifing factors. first the books must be required as part of addimission to the institution. This means no sharing or using the library copy. Second the books can only be availible from the institution, no ecampus, no E-bay. To the other college students how many of you would qualified for this credit. Not I, every class I took from first year to grad school, the classes had required books, but the instructor could not force me get the book. We also had the college bookstore and the off campus bookstore.

content: Poll: Paterson's Approval Rating Hits New Low Reported by: WROC-TV Monday, Mar 23, 2009 @11:25am EST Only 14 percent of voters are prepared to elect him in 2010. 67% say they prefer "someone else. " New Yorkers Continue to Move to Other States Reported by: WROC-TV Monday, Mar 23, 2009 @08:36am EST The exodus of New Yorkers to other states continues. That's according to the latest U.S. Census figures, which indicate residents moved out of New York at the third fastest rate in the country. Perhaps the only variable that keeps New York from having the highest out migration rate is the influx of immigrants, who mostly move to New York city.

content: Both parties (and the other third parties as well, to a lesser extent) are populated by people who have gotten good at playing "the game" and all they are interested in doing is winning it. Pelosi has pretty much admitted it - she is not interested in good governance, just increasing the power of the party in Congress. The Republicans are just the same (although more subtle). Still, my vote: The American voter. A person that can give a 14% approval rating to Congress as a whole while simultaneously giving their own Congressmen 60% approval ratings.

content: Roland Burris-I did not have any contact with Blogo---well I might have talked with somebody from his staff----I tried to raise money for him, but coould not. Chuck Schumer, makes great statements about what he has does for the people, until you read and understand the bills he has passed. The one of his I like is you get up to a $1000 credit for text books to help poor struggling students. Sounds great, until you find out the qualifing factors. first the books must be required as part of addimission to the institution. This means no sharing or using the library copy. Second the books can only be availible from the institution, no ecampus, no E-bay. To the other college students how many of you would qualified for this credit. Not I, every class I took from first year to grad school, the classes had required books, but the instructor could not force me get the book. We also had the college bookstore and the off campus bookstore.
